title: Flames shoot out of plane’s engine moments after take-off
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Video captured flames shooting out from the engine of an Air China plane just seconds after it took off from Washington Dulles airport.

One bystander began filming the Boeing 777 airliner after hearing a loud noise and spotting the flames around one of the engines.

When the mid-flight fire happened at 4.39pm on September 17, the Air China 818 flight was heading from the airport in Washington D.C to Beijing.

Advertisement

Advertisement

A witness, who did not wish to be named, told Viral Hog said: ‘I heard a very loud bang.

‘I spun around to see the flames shooting out of the left engine of the 777.

Flames shoot out of the Air China plane after it took off from Washington Dulles Airport (Picture: ViralHog)

The plane was forced to return to Washington Dulles airport following the fire (Picture: ViralHog)

‘Realizing they were experiencing compressor stalls, I took out my phone and started videoing.’

The Boeing 777 model can seat up to 396 people.

The in-flight emergency forced the plane’s pilot to dump fuel before he returned the plane to Washington Dullles just over an hour later.

The Federal Aviation Administration said that the Air China flight landed safely Tuesday in Washington after reporting an engine fire and that its pilot was in contact with air traffic control at all times.

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: Within seconds of departing Washington Dulles, the Air China plane's engine caught on fire.
